meanings.definition: A collection or mass of things gathered together.
meanings.sent1: The agglomerate of colorful leaves on the ground caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: The agglomerate of books on the shelf looked messy.
meanings.sent3: The agglomerate of toys in the playroom made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent4: The agglomerate of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The agglomerate of seashells on the beach sparkled in the sun.

meanings.definition: To gather into a cluster or mass.
meanings.sent1: I will agglomerate the scattered papers on my desk.
meanings.sent2: The chef will agglomerate the ingredients for the soup.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally agglomerated all my socks in one drawer.
meanings.sent4: The dancers agglomerated on the stage for the final pose.
meanings.sent5: She will agglomerate the flowers into a beautiful bouquet.

meanings.definition: To form into a mass or cluster.
meanings.sent1: The snow will agglomerate into a large snowball.
meanings.sent2: The artist will agglomerate clay into a sculpture.
meanings.sent3: I agglomerated the pillows on the couch for a cozy movie night.
meanings.sent4: The ideas began to agglomerate in her mind as she brainstormed.
meanings.sent5: The clouds started to agglomerate in the sky before the storm.
